The Elder Nun Who Gave a Single Bowl of Food
In the city of Bandhumatī,
a noble named Bandhumā;
I was the king’s wife,
and we lived together.
Having sat down in private,
I thought like this at that time:
‘What is to be taken along is indeed
the wholesome, but I have done none.
A great affliction, bitter,
horrible, very terrible,
I will surely go to hell,

Having approached the king,🔽I spoke this statement:
‘Give me a single ascetic,
I will feed him, noble.’
The great king gave me
an ascetic with developed faculties;
Having taken his bowl,
I filled it with choice food.
Having filled it with choice food,
I applied fragrant ointments;
Having covered it with a cloth,
I covered it with a pair of garments.
This was my support,
I remember for as long as I live;
Having inspired my mind there,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.
I made great merit for thirty kings of the gods,
and whatever I wished for in my mind
was produced just as I desired.

and having been well-trained,
